name: Blueberry Crumb Bars
description: Oh-so-crumbly blueberry crumb bars bursting with fresh blueberries with a hint of refreshing lemon goodness!
recipeIngredient: 1/2 cup 1 stick unsalted butter, cut into cubes

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Lightly coat an 8×8 baking dish with nonstick spray.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Lightly coat an 8×8 baking dish with nonstick spray.

recipeInstructions.text: In a small bowl, combine 1/4 cup sugar and cornstarch. Stir in lemon juice. Add blueberries and gently toss to combine; set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: In a small bowl, combine 1/4 cup sugar and cornstarch. Stir in lemon juice. Add blueberries and gently toss to combine; set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, combine flour, remaining 1/2 cup sugar, baking powder and salt. Add egg yolk, vanilla, lemon zest and cold butter, using your fingers to work the butter into the dry ingredients until it resembles coarse crumbs.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large bowl, combine flour, remaining 1/2 cup sugar, baking powder and salt. Add egg yolk, vanilla, lemon zest and cold butter, using your fingers to work the butter into the dry ingredients until it resembles coarse crumbs.

recipeInstructions.text: Spread 2/3 of the batter into the prepared baking dish. Spread blueberry mixture evenly over the bottom layer. Sprinkle with remaining 1/3 of the batter and turbinado sugar.
recipeInstructions.name: Spread 2/3 of the batter into the prepared baking dish. Spread blueberry mixture evenly over the bottom layer. Sprinkle with remaining 1/3 of the batter and turbinado sugar.

recipeInstructions.text: Place into oven and bake until lightly browned, about 35-40 minutes. Let cool slightly before cutting into bars.
recipeInstructions.name: Place into oven and bake until lightly browned, about 35-40 minutes. Let cool slightly before cutting into bars.

review.reviewBody:
I decided to give these a try for Mother's Day. Unfortunately, my wife was not satisfied with the initial batch and was disappointed in me once again! The main issue is that you couldn't taste anything besides butter. They  looked amazing, and the texture was perfect, but you couldn't taste the blueberries at all. In a desperate move to save my marriage, I made a 2nd batch and improvised on the recipe a bit by making 3 main adjustments:

1. I used 3/4 a stick of butter instead of an entire stick (6 tbsp)
2. I added 1 cup of blackberries on top of the 2 cups of blueberries the recipe calls for. I'm sure raspberries would work just as fine as well, but the purpose here was to add a bit more tartness so that you can taste the fruit. 
3.We also added 2 teaspoons of lemon juice instead of 1 teaspoon to the berry mixture

With these adjustments, the recipe came out perfect. So much so in fact, that I am going to give these to my Mother-in-Law instead of my wife, because she is the ultimate boss in the family and her approval is more important.
Made these for Easter dessert with ice cream.  I am not much of a baker, made the recipe exactly as written - these were super easy and delicious.  Thank you!
